page.title: 07Education in Bradley.
page.content: In 1344 Humphrey de Hastang, Rector of Bradley gave some land to the village. Farmers rented the land,the money was used by the parishoners. Children of the parish were taught by the priest of the Lady Chapel who was supported by the endowment. Later the endowment was used to set up a school. This building is next to the present school. The school was at times a grammar school. The boys were taught,reading, writing, arithmetic, grammar and classics by the master. The girls were taught by his wife,who also taught the younger boys.In 1864,the school was in two parts about 25 boys taught by the master and about the same number of girls and small boys taught by his wife.No fees were charged.Bradley Endowed School Trust was set up to look after the lands,buildings and money of the endowment.
